articles.title: 학생당 42센트로 AI 부정행위 잡기: NYU 교수의 AI 구술시험 실험
articles.contents: Learn how to detect AI-generated homework and academic dishonesty through an NYU professor's practical testing framework. The experiment reveals vulnerabilities in traditional grading systems when students use AI tools and demonstrates detection methods educators can implement.

articles.title: Tailwind 제작사, 엔지니어링 팀의 75% 해고
articles.contents: Understand how Tailwind CSS optimized documentation for LLM training by implementing the /llms.txt endpoint standard. This approach consolidates all documentation pages into a structured format that improves AI model learning efficiency and reduces training data fragmentation.

articles.contents: Add persistent long-term memory to Claude Code, Gemini CLI, and other coding agents with a single line of code to run locally. This enhancement allows AI coding assistants to retain context and improve performance across multiple sessions without external dependencies.

articles.contents: Use Byterover to manage AI coding agent context like Git version control—push local context to shared workspaces and pull it across Cursor, Windsurf, and Claude Code. Teams can maintain a single source of truth for AI-assisted development across different editors.

articles.title: A Coding Implementation to Build a Unified Apache Beam Pipeline Demonstrating Batch and Stream Processing with Event-Time Windowing Using DirectRunner
articles.contents: Build a unified Apache Beam pipeline using DirectRunner that handles both batch and stream processing with fixed-window event-time aggregation. Learn to configure triggers, allowed lateness, and pane accumulation modes to consistently process on-time and late-arriving events without external infrastructure.

articles.title: Implementing Softmax From Scratch: Avoiding the Numerical Stability Trap
articles.contents: Implement numerically stable Softmax from scratch in PyTorch by avoiding overflow and underflow errors in exponential calculations. The guide demonstrates why naive implementations fail with extreme logit values and how proper normalization techniques prevent NaN propagation during training.
